title: More efficient disk sorting logic needed when there is a border value for the row count
OB: When sorting on disk, if we have 40000 rows of data and set the program to process only a subset of the data (less than 40000 rows), the following operations are performed by DtE: 1.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Sort the data on disk with 40000 rows. 2. Set the program to process a subset of the data (less than 40000 rows). 3. Observe that DtE performs the following operations: 1. Saves the file as a temporary file. 2. Calls the file into memory. 3. Sorts the data. 4. Saves the file to another temporary file. 5.
